xwikidoc.name: phenotipsArchive20140303

xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 03 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <SayAsh> has joined #phenotips 08:52 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 09:30 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 09:58 <gauravsaini03> has quit 09:58 <vishnu93> has joined #phenotips 10:23 <akats> has joined #phenotips 10:24 <sdumitriu> SayAsh: Hi, you had a question for me? 10:35 <SayAsh> yes, I am getting errors while building the code. I tried to build it folderwise later on and i found the errors are coming from distribution folder of the code 10:35 <sdumitriu> Which version of Maven are you using? 10:36 <SayAsh> 3.2.1 10:36 <SayAsh> its the latest version 10:36 <sdumitriu> Can you switch to 3.0.x? 10:37 <sdumitriu> There's a known bug in one of the maven plugins used for the build 10:37 <SayAsh> ok then i switch to 3.0 10:41 <vishnu93> Hi, I have a question on modifying phenotips 10:41 <sdumitriu> Hi vishnu93 10:41 <vishnu93> how can I see the changes which I made when running phenotips locally? 10:42 <vishnu93> I've tried restarting the server 10:42 <sdumitriu> Where are you making the changes, and how do you obtain the local instance? 10:43 <vishnu93> I'm modifying the components/patients/ folder 10:43 <vishnu93> the UI part 10:44 <vishnu93> by locally I mean offline 10:44 <sdumitriu> OK, I see 10:44 <sdumitriu> Thre are two options 10:44 <sdumitriu> 1: rebuild everything with "mvn clean install", unzip what you get in distribution/standalone/target, and run PhenoTips from there 10:45 <sdumitriu> This takes some time 10:46 <sdumitriu> 2: rebuild only that module ("mvn install" from components/patient-data/ui/) and from the running instance, go to Administration -> Content -> Import, uplod the .xar file you got in the archive, click on it once it uploads, and import either all the files or the files you just modified 10:46 <sdumitriu> This will take less time 10:46 <sdumitriu> There's also a third option: 10:48 <sdumitriu> 3: modify the contents directly in the running instance, through the browse; for example if you want to edit PhenoTips.PatientSheet, go to http://localhost:8080/bin/edit/PhenoTips/PatientSheet 10:48 <sdumitriu> This way you'll see the changes almost instantly 10:48 <vishnu93> I see 10:49 <vishnu93> Thank you, that helped a lot! 10:49 <sdumitriu> Once you're happy with the code, you can export the changed document as XAR (there's a menu entry for that in the UI), unzip it (it's a plain .zip file with a different extension), and copy back the .xml files over the original sources 10:49 <sdumitriu> You'll have to run "mvn xar:format" from the ui module to clean up the .xml though 10:50 <vishnu93> cool I'll try it out :) 11:01 <IonelPopescu> has quit 11:10 <akats> sdumitriu: I've got a working page that outputs user data in json format. However, it's mixed with XWiki html. a GET with &xpage=plain gives out data mixed with html, but adding &outputSyntax=plain breaks the code 11:28 <akats> How important is performance for this functionality? 11:29 <gauravsaini03> has joined #phenotips 11:30 <akats> Actually a better question, how important is proper pagination? 11:31 <sdumitriu> Not at all 11:31 <sdumitriu> We could live with a static list 11:31 <sdumitriu> Listing all the requests 11:32 <akats> Ok. Sweet. 11:53 <SayAsh> @sdumitriu, the code has been built. Can you guide me to next step 11:54 <sdumitriu> https://gsoc.ccm.sickkids.ca/GoogleSummerOfCode/FirstSteps 12:10 <SayAsh> 2nd step says build phenotips and run it. How to run it? 12:10 <akats> Which OS are you using 12:10 <SayAsh> windows 8 12:11 <akats> Do you see a file called start.bat 12:12 <SayAsh> sorry, but where would I find this file? 12:13 <sdumitriu> SayAsh: Go to distribution\standalone\target 12:13 <vishnu93> has quit 12:13 <sdumitriu> There should be a .zip file in there 12:13 <sdumitriu> Unzip it 12:13 <sdumitriu> That's the freshly built PhenoTips instance 12:13 <sdumitriu> In it there's a start.bat file, run it 12:14 <sdumitriu> It will open a console 12:14 <sdumitriu> Once it prints "Server started, you can now open http://localhost:8080/ in your browser" do that 12:35 <SayAsh> success!! localhost opened 12:39 <SayAsh> thanks !! 12:42 <qwebirc72953> has quit 13:09 <reid_a> has quit 13:17 <vishnu93> has joined #phenotips 13:19 <reid_anderson> has quit 13:22 <gauravsaini03> has quit 14:27 <SayAsh> has quit 14:42 <vishnu93> has quit 14:46 <akats> sdumitriu: if I do $response.sendRedirect will Ajax request follow it? 14:46 <sdumitriu> Yes 14:47 <akats> Sweet 14:57 <akats> So I wanted to validate the user using the default XWiki method validateUser, however I ran into the problem that getting user's validation key 14:57 <akats> I get back a hash, for ex hash:SHA-512:f1bc6beb91a5daa637fa2f232d6082aa3aa39068da01a9c84f94be64f1513ef8c8ca4c183f62b9f0c9777c815dfe3915984fc6832b249ce73c2cb285365c8868 14:58 <akats> is there a way to convert it? 14:58 <sdumitriu> No 14:58 <sdumitriu> It's a hash 14:58 <sdumitriu> You can't use the validateUser method 14:59 <IonelPopescu> has joined #phenotips 14:59 <akats> Ok I see 15:23 <pradeeban> has quit 16:27 <mcupak> has quit 16:35 <nclandrei> has joined #phenotips 16:35 <nclandrei> hi everyone 16:40 <reid_a> has quit 16:43 <sdumitriu> Hi nclandrei 16:43 <nclandrei> how is it going? still a lot of work? 16:43 <sdumitriu> Always 16:43 <nclandrei> yep, here as well.. the midterm period has just started 16:43 <nclandrei> )-: 17:14 <Ravneet> has quit 17:22 <sdumitriu> has quit 17:26 <nclandrei> has quit 17:26 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 17:48 <akif500> has quit 18:10 <reid_a> has quit 18:25 <akats> has quit 18:30 <Ravneet> has quit 18:51 <sdumitriu> is now known as <sdumitriu_[Away]> 19:23 <IonelPopescu> has quit 20:20 <aw1231> has joined #phenotips 20:21 <aw1231> has quit 21:38 <reid_a> has quit 22:08 <reid_a> has quit
